data.title: If you love authentic Japanese flavors and atmosphere - that's you place to go!
data.text: I live in the Bay area for some years now, and Sushi Cal became one of my regular dinner places in Berkeley. The food is great, the chef knows what he is doing, beers and Japanese liquor are delicious and Fridays you have a band playing Jazz classics. Awesome!

data.title: Best sushi this side of the Pacific!
data.text:
Excellent sashimi, miso soup to die for and lemon chicken like no other!

A most lucky find, as the salmon. Kama was simply award-winning for sure!  

Great staff: Friendly and very humble and professional.  I am forced to wait patiently until I will have the chance to get back!

I simply can't say enough GOOD about this place and look VERY forward to our next week.  

Thanks much,
Bill

data.title: OK sushi
data.text:
This is a small sushi place in the general UC Berkeley area (but two large blocks away).
I ordered a sashimi combination, which was fine (nothing to complaint about, but also
nothing to write home about). A large sashimi combination and a miso soup cost me $21 before tip.

 They seem to know what they are doing on the sushi bar, and they have daily specials,
which I realized only after I finished.

data.title: Best Sushi ever in Berkeley, California
data.text: Great Japanese food in Berkeley, California. We've been going to this place for over ten years, always a delight. Fresh fish, always, and great service! We love the live music on Friday nights. Highly recommended.

data.title: Great specials, friendly counter service
data.text: Sushi Cal is a Berkeley institution nestled onto the ground floor facing MLK near the new Trader Joe's. The family-owned restaurant is also family-run, the best seat in the house is on the counter where the chef-owner makes your sushi to order. The specials are the best indicator of what's best on the menu. I could do with slightly lower prices for the more basic sushi, but for some of the daily specials some real creativity is going on and it's worth the price. This is not a foodie hipster place; Sushi California is solid, basic, family-owned quality.

data.title: AWFUL service, mediocre sushi, borderline sanitary
data.text:
I haven't written a review on Trip advisor in a while, and definitely since the site renovation.  But I came back just to tell everyone how LOUSY this restaurant is.  I wrote an extensive review on yelp about my horrific dining experience, so I won't go into so much detail here.  In brief, between waiting to be seated (even though there were already tables open when we got there), waiting for menus, waiting to order, waiting for food and then having part of our order LOST, we probably wasted a good 1.5 hours in WAIT time.  This is absolutely unacceptable and the staff was absolutely unapologetic about it.

The food was ok at best.  The sushi was mediocre.  On a scale from Tsukiji fish market to American sushi buffet, I would say it's only about one step above the latter in quality and freshness (I've eaten at some sushi buffets with better fish also).  YET SOMEHOW, the price leans towards the former!  Ridiculously overpriced for what I know is low quality, frozen fish.  This place is also barely sanitary, and I've eaten in some of the dingiest holes in the walls you can imagine with no fear.  There were insects on my table and the waitstaff was not good about clearing tables.  

I will never come here again and I hope you don't waste your time here either.  If you're looking for sushi in this price range, go to Joshu-ya or Kirala near by.

data.title: Overall Good Experience - AWESOME Agadashi Tofu!
data.text: The sushi was solid - my SO loved the fish! And the vegetarian selections were also quite good, especially the Agadashi Tofu (something I order at every japanese restaurant I go to).

data.title: Great fresh food, I don't understand other reviews I eat sushi all the time
data.text: The food and service was great. Awesome price and specials I would eat here again any day!

data.title: Cozy place, lousy food
data.text: The food was mediocre to poor. Soup was boring, spinach salad was tasteless except for the strong vinegar,the sushi was mushy and tasteless (I think it had been frozen).

data.title: They use the freshest ingredients.  The Hokkaido Roll is terrific.
data.text: They use the freshest ingredients.  The Hokkaido Roll is terrific.

data.title: Best Sushi in the states!!!  The freshest fish, and best super white tuna.  Prices are good.  THis place puts the more...
data.text: Best Sushi in the states!!!  The freshest fish, and best super white tuna.  Prices are good.  THis place puts the more expensive sushi places in Berkeley to shame.

data.title: Stuck in the 70s decor, chipped tableware, forgettable food and less than welcoming service. You can give it a miss...
data.text: Stuck in the 70s decor, chipped tableware, forgettable food and less than welcoming service. You can give it a miss, especially if you don't want to smell like the oil turned rancid after repeated rounds of tempura-frying...

data.title: Nice small sushi place. Good quality and prices.
data.text: Nice small sushi place. Good quality and prices.

data.title: Sehr nettes Restaurant. Super lekere Sushi.
data.text:
Optisch nicht so, aber die Qualität vom Essen ist super. Frisch und lecker. 

Wir waren zwei Tage hinter einander da. 
Erster Tag Sushi gegessen. Sehr lecker. 
Preis ist auch in Ordnung. Nicht billig, aber akzeptabel. 

Zweiter tag Suppe. Okinawa Soba (Ramen)
Lecker, frisch und der Preis ist okay. Gute große Portion.

data.title: Ausgezeichnetes Sushi in wohliger Atmosphäre
data.text: Auch diesmal war ich bei meinem Bay Area-Besuch hier, und die Qualität ist und bleibt konstant hervorragend. Neben Sushi, Sashimi, Fleischgerichten und vegetarischen Angeboten gibt es stets saisonale Specials, wie diesmal eine köstliche Krebsfleisch-Roll. Dazu punktet das Restaurant mit einer Auswahl an Soju. Der Service: Wie immer flink, freundlich und aufmerksam. Die Preislage: Gerade für die Bay-Area erstaunlich günstig. Meiner Meinung nach DER Top-Spot für Sushi in Berkeley und Umgebung!

data.title: 일본인 스시 쉐프, 적당한 가격
data.text:
이 동네에 수많은 초밥 집이 있지만 일본인 쉐프가 직접 스시를 쥐어주는 곳은 이 곳 말고는 별로 없다. 
월요일 금요일에는 라이브 재즈 듀오 공연이 있어 데이트 하기에 좋다.

data.title: Überdurchschnittlich gutes und gemütliches Sushi-Restaurant
data.text: Etwa zwei Mal pro Jahr bin ich in der Bay Area - ein Besuch bei Sushi California ist jedes Mal fest eingeplant. Das Restaurant ist klein und gemütlich, der Service äußerst herzlich und aufmerksam. Die Sushi-Auswahl ist groß, die Qualität 1A - und das zu sehr fairen Preisen. Freitags gibt´s zudem dezente Live-Musik.
